segments.en: Linked Discourses 7
2. Lay Followers
17. The Builder

segments.pli: Ekaṃ samayaṃ bhagavā kosalesu viharati aññatarasmiṃ vanasaṇḍe.
segments.en: At one time the Buddha was staying in the land of the Kosalans in a certain forest grove.

segments.pli: Tena kho pana samayena navakammikabhāradvājo brāhmaṇo tasmiṃ vanasaṇḍe kammantaṃ kārāpeti.
segments.en: Now at that time the brahmin Bhāradvāja the Builder was doing some building work in that jungle thicket.

segments.pli: Addasā kho navakammikabhāradvājo brāhmaṇo bhagavantaṃ aññatarasmiṃ sālarukkhamūle nisinnaṃ pallaṅkaṃ ābhujitvā ujuṃ kāyaṃ paṇidhāya parimukhaṃ satiṃ upaṭṭhapetvā.
segments.en: He saw the Buddha sitting down cross-legged at the root of a certain sal tree, with his body straight, and mindfulness established right there.
Seeing this, it occurred to him,

segments.pli: “ahaṃ kho imasmiṃ vanasaṇḍe kammantaṃ kārāpento ramāmi.
segments.en: “I enjoy doing this building work here in the jungle.

segments.pli: Ayaṃ samaṇo gotamo kiṃ kārāpento ramatī”ti?
segments.en: I wonder what the ascetic Gotama enjoys doing?”

segments.pli: Atha kho navakammikabhāradvājo brāhmaṇo yena bhagavā tenupasaṅkami. upasaṅkamitvā bhagavantaṃ gāthāya ajjhabhāsi:
segments.en: Then Bhāradvāja the Builder went up to the Buddha and addressed him in verse:
“What kind of work do you do
as a mendicant in the sal jungle?
How do you find enjoyment
alone in the wilderness, Gotama?”
“There’s nothing I need to do in the jungle;
my jungle’s cut down at the root, it’s withered away.
With jungle cleared and free of thorns,
I enjoy being alone in the jungle, having given up discontent.”

segments.pli: Evaṃ vutte, navakammikabhāradvājo brāhmaṇo bhagavantaṃ etadavoca:
segments.en: When he had spoken, the brahmin Bhāradvāja the Builder said to the Buddha,
“Excellent, Master Gotama …

segments.pli: upāsakaṃ maṃ bhavaṃ gotamo dhāretu ajjatagge pāṇupetaṃ saraṇaṃ gatan”ti.
segments.en: From this day forth, may Master Gotama remember me as a lay follower who has gone for refuge for life.”
